description: Copied A.H. 592 [A.D. 1196] by Abū Naṣr ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn al-ḥasan ibn Abī Saʻd al-Ṭabīb. Fols. 76; 17.2 x 13 cm.; written surface 12.5 x 9.2 cm.; 19 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; entries in red. A collection containing : 1. Kitāb Inqādh al-bashar min al-jabr wa-al-qadar, a philosophical treatise discussing fatalism and predestination and establishing manʼs free will. 2. Another treatise on free will entitled Kitāb al-Taqrīr li-awjuh al-taqdīr. A few marginal notes and glosses; MS in good condition but worm-eaten; Arabic binding. Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.
author: ʻĀmirī, Abū al-ḥasan Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf
title: Kitāb Inqādh al-bashar min al-jabr wa-al-qadar
creator: ʻĀmirī, Abū al-ḥasan Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf
subject: Fate and fatalism—Religious aspects—Islam—Early works to 1800
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
